description: 2022 Single Family Residential Mandatory Requirements Summary organized as 6 dense text panels (3 columns x 2 rows). Covers building envelope (air leakage, insulation, fenestration, cool roof), mechanical/HVAC (duct insulation/sealing, ventilation, equipment efficiency), water heating, lighting (high-efficacy), solar ready provisions, HERS verification requirements, EV charging readiness, and energy storage readiness.
key_content: 2022 Title 24 Mandatory Requirements Summary â€” comprehensive reference
Building envelope: air leakage sealing, ceiling/attic insulation, wall insulation, raised floor insulation, slab edge insulation, fenestration certification
Roof deck / cool roof / radiant barrier requirements
Fireplace damper and combustion air requirements
Pipe insulation: hot water pipe insulation per pipe diameter
Duct insulation: minimum R-value for supply and return ducts
Duct sealing: mastic or listed duct tape per SMACNA standards
Mechanical ventilation: ASHRAE 62.2 whole-house and local exhaust requirements
Space conditioning efficiency requirements (HVAC minimum efficiency standards)
Water heater efficiency requirements and pipe insulation
High-efficacy lighting: all permanently installed luminaires
Solar ready zone requirements for new construction
Combustion appliances: sealed combustion / direct-vent requirements
HERS verification items: duct leakage, refrigerant charge, airflow, fan watt draw, QII
PV photovoltaic system sizing requirements for new construction
Battery energy storage readiness provisions
EV charging readiness: dedicated circuit provisions
Demand response capable thermostat requirements
Quality Insulation Installation (QII) verification requirements
Moisture control and vapor barrier requirements
